org.transitime.avl

Class TimeoutHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.avl.TimeoutHandler

  • public class TimeoutHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    For handling when a vehicle doesn't report its position for too long. Makes the vehicle unpredictable if a timeout occurs.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static TimeoutHandler get() 
      void handlePossibleTimeout(AvlReport newAvlReport)
      To be called every time a new AVL report is handled.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static TimeoutHandler get()

      • handlePossibleTimeout

        public void handlePossibleTimeout(AvlReport newAvlReport)
        To be called every time a new AVL report is handled. This way can handle vehicles timing out even when not running in real time due to running in batch/playback mode.

        This method is synchronized since the map itself is unsynced and need to make sure that don't have concurrent access.

        Parameters:
        avlReport -
